snippet: Although President Ashraf Ghani’s aides deny the accusations, there is growing concern that cooperating with his rival, Abdullah Abdullah, is not high on his list.
abstract: Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani seems to be consolidating power rather than decentralizing it as promised and shows no sign of cooperating with rival Abdullah Abdullah.

byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Although President Ashraf Ghani’s aides deny the accusations, there is growing concern that cooperating with his rival, Abdullah Abdullah, is not high on his list.

headline.main: Afghan Leader Said to Be Centralizing Power as Unity Government Plan Stalls
headline.print_headline: Afghan President Said to Be Centralizing Power as a Plan to Share It Stalls
